english: berry; small berry; strawberry (in compounds); bramble berry

etymology.interpretation: 艹 flags a plant-related meaning, pointing to something botanical. 每 supplies the sound value méi (approximate from měi), and the whole form came to denote small berries, as seen in compounds like 草莓 and 黑莓.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃野莓(我喜歡吃野莓)。
examples.english: I like to eat wild berries.

examples.chinese: 夏天的草莓很甜(夏天的草莓很甜)。
examples.english: Strawberries in summer are very sweet.

examples.chinese: 这片山谷到处都是黑莓(這片山谷到處都是黑莓)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè piàn shāngǔ dàochù dōu shì hēiméi.
examples.english: This valley is full of blackberries.
